page.title: 13Sponsored Walk
page.content: During July 1985,22 people went on a sponsored walk to raise money for the Institute.We left there at 11am and went along Wheal Lane,which at one time was the main road to Bakewell.We turned towards White Lodge,and then across the A6 into Monsal Dale.At Monsal Head we stopped for lunch and here 3 walkers including a four year old dropped out.We then followed the river to Litton Mill.A number of ill treated apprentices from there were buried in Taddington churchyard since Ellis Needham had built an apprentice house(since pulled down) across the river in Priestcliffe.At Miller's Dale we turned up into Long Lane which was the road to Tideswell before the Turnpike was built,and then through the village back to the Institute.The walk was ten miles,but I didn't feel tired.We raised about Â£200.
